line_1: The Brother, pleas'd to hear his Hammers chime,
line_2: Soon harmoniz'd their Notes to proper Time:

line_1: One epithet supplies their constant chime,
line_2: Damn'd bad, damn'd good, damn'd low, and damn'd sublime!

line_1: Or trill in air the soft symphonious chime,
line_2: When rapt CECILIA lifts her eye sublime,
Which, since the birth of time,

line_1: Streams tinkle sweetly in poetic chime,
line_2: Nature indeed looks prettily in rhime,

line_1: If now and then I curse, my curses chime,
line_2: Nor can I pray, unless I pray in rime.

line_1: There let her sit, with her Infernal Chyme,
line_2: And put the Shrieks and Groans of Fiends in Rhime.

line_1: 'Tis folly's bell that rings the pleasing chyme;
line_2: I own I am; and dabbling thus in rhyme,

line_1: To make the rough Recital aptly chime,
line_2: Or bring the Sum of Gallia's Loss to Rhime,

line_1: And knows no leisure; till the distant chime
line_2: Of Sabbath bells he hears at sermon time,

line_1: Tho' it sweetly should flow and in melody chime,
line_2: But scorn'd be the muse, unrewarded the rhime,

line_1: The CYCLOPS' Hammers could not truer chime;
line_2: Down one, one up, so well they keep the Time,
